results.title: Big brown beastie, big brown face
results.brief_description: Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman who has represented Australia in five Olympic games. Tells of his life with horses and competition riding and shows him at a dressage event in Canada. Also covers the Australian Equestrian Team at the Montreal Olympic Games in 1976. Princess Anne appears in a dressage event at the games. Title music by Mike Oldfield. No other credits available.

results.title: Big boys don't cry
results.creator_credit: Tee Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: A young boy wanders through bushland enjoying nature’s beauty. Carrying a slug gun he initially shoots at a paper cup, however images of TV western gunfights go through his mind and on impulse he takes aim and shoots a bird. Realising what he has done the boy runs away as scenes of real life violence flash before him - scenes of war and innocent killing. The boy makes the decision to return to target shooting. A non-verbal film with b&w sequences. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Big Bill: the story of a heron
results.creator_credit: Anthony Bomford, Hugh Miles and RSPB Film and Video Unit
results.brief_description: This beautifully photographed film looks at one of the most well-known water-birds, the grey heron. Habitat, nesting, breeding, raising the young and collecting food are aspects of the heron’s life that are examined. Narrated by Eric Thompson.

results.title: Big Ben
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The centenary of Big Ben and the history behind the famous chime. Prints from old editions of the “Illustrated London News” recall the casting and installation of the bell. Its significance as a symbol of hope during wartime is illustrated by a series of interviews. Commentary by James Mason.

results.title: The Bicyclist
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Film Junior and Kobenhavns Politi
results.brief_description: A safety education film presented from the point of view of a red bicycle, owned first by a boy who obeyed the traffic rules and then by one who brought himself and the bicycle to a sad fate. The first boy is seen riding sensibly on the road and passing a police cycling test. The bicycle is then stolen by a lad whose reckless riding leads to a serious accident to himself and the bicycle falling into the river to rust. The film brings out a number of specific points about safe and dangerous cycling.

results.title: Beyond the volta
results.creator_credit: Enoch Vander Pule and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the economic and political progress of a region in West Africa now known as Trans-Volta Togoland. Points out that once local government was set up, steps were taken to provide the region with a system of roads and bridges, and adequate water supply and hospitals and clinics to help in the fight against leprosy and other diseases prevelant in tropical countries. Advances in industrial and agricultural fields were also made; these included re-establishment of the palm oil industry and the introduction of modern methods and machinery. Progress is being made in the educational field by the establishment of technical colleges and universities.

results.title: Beyond the tooth of time
results.brief_description: American teenage scouts visit Philmont Scout Ranch in Texas. In rugged beautiful natural surroundings they enjoy rough trail hiking, camping, shooting, fishing, archery, cattle work, forestry, riding and learn about rocks, gold and the early history of the area. The twenty-one camps in the ranch provide these boys with a taste for life in the wilderness as it was lived by early American pioneers. No credits available.
